scenarioDescription:
The K2-101 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-101 is a star with 0.82 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.76 times its radius. It is located 614.25 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.79 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-101 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-101 system


K2-101 b

K2-101 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-02, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-101 b is 4.675 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-101 b is 2.000 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.2, and a semi-major axis of 0.1124 astronomical units, K2-101 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system K2-101, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-101 - System With 1 Exoplanet
